description: Guess the answers to the following.

dialogs.answer:
1. Open the folder containing essential files of QBASIC.
2. Find and select the file QB.EXE.
3. Double-click on the filename or press Enter key.

After loading QBASIC, you will see the QBASIC window screen on your
desktop with Welcome Dialog box.

dialogs.text: How to clear the welcome dialog box?
dialogs.answer: In QBASIC, the Welcome Dialog box can be cleared by pressing the Esc (Escape) key or clicking the "Close" or "X" button on the dialog box.

dialogs.text: How to enlarge the QBASIC windows to fit on the screen?
dialogs.answer: Press the Alt + Enter key.

dialogs.text: What are the four main parts of the QBASIC Editor Screen?
dialogs.answer:
They are:

1. Menu Bar
2. Editor Window
3. Toolbar
4. Status Bar

dialogs.text: How to write a new program?
dialogs.answer:
1. Click on the File menu or press ALT + F.
2. Select the New Program option.
A blank screen with a blinking cursor appears. Now, you can type your
program.

dialogs.text: What are the steps to save a program?
dialogs.answer:
1. Click on the File menu or press ALT + F.
2. Select the Save or Save As option.
A dialog box will appear.
3. Specify the desired drive location and folder where you want to save
the file. (Example: C:\Document\Myfirstprogram)
4. Type the filename in the File Name box.
5. Click on OK or Press the Enter key.

dialogs.text: How to run a program QBASIC?
dialogs.answer:
1. Click on the Run menu or
Press ALT +R.
2. Select the Start option.
Or
Press the F5 key to continue execution from the previous
point or SHIFT + F5 key to execute from the beginning.
You can press any key to return to the QBASIC Editor Screen.

dialogs.text: How to open an existing file?
dialogs.answer:
1. Click the File menu or Press ALT + F.
2. Select the Open option. A dialog box appears.
3. Choose the filename from the location where the file is saved.
4. Select the filename.
5. Click on OK or Press the Enter key.

dialogs.text: How to cut and paste in QBASIC?
dialogs.answer:
1. Highlight the line of statement or block of statement to be moved.
2. Click on the Edit menu and select Cut.
Or
Press the Shift + Del key to cut.
3. Go to the desired location.
4. Click on the Edit menu and select Paste.
Or
Press Shift + Insert key for paste.

dialogs.text: How to exit from QBASIC?
dialogs.answer:
1. Click on File menu or Press ALT + F.
2. Select Exit option
